questions.question:
Under a microscope, plant cells appeared rigid in shape unlike flexible animal cells.
Which feature can explain this difference?
(a) Cell Wall
(b) Vacuole
(c) Cytoskeleton
(d) Plasma Membrane

Which type of joint allows bending of the elbow joint and has a synovial cavity?
(a) Pubic symphysis
(b) Fibrous joint
(c) Hinge joint
(d) Cartilaginous joint

A man with blood type A and a woman with blood type B have a child with blood type 0. What are the genotypes of the parents?
(a) IAIA and IBIB
(b) IAi and IBi
(c) IAIB and ii
(d) IAi and IBIB

Which of the following is correct about the structure of the brain?
(a) Cerebral cortex is outer part consists of grey matter
(b) Cerebral medulla is inner part consists of grey matter
(c) Cerebral cortex is inner part consists of white matter
(d) Cerebral medulla is outer part consists of white matter
questions.answer: Cerebral cortex is outer part consists of grey matter

questions.question:
In the E. coli lac operon, what molecule binds to the repressor protein to inactivate it?
(a) Glucose
(b) Lactose (as allolactose)
(c) CAMP
(d) RNA Polymerase

What is the primary function of siRNA in a eukaryotic cell?
(a) To transport amino acids to the ribosome
(b) To act as a template for DNA synthesis
(c) To bind to mRNA and trigger its degradation
(d) To unwind DNA during replication
questions.answer: To bind to mRNA and trigger its degradation

questions.question:
The pH of a $1.0\times10^{-3}$ M HCl solution is approximately:
(a) 1
(b) 2
(c) 3
(d) 4

Which of the following is correct about isotopes?
(a) Same neutrons, different protons
(b) Same protons, different neutrons
(c) Same protons, different electrons
(d) Same electrons, different protons

Which aqueous salt solution is basic?
(a) NH4Cl
(b) NaCl
(c) $KNO_{3}$
(d) $Na_{2}CO_{3}$

Which of the following explains high melting points of ionic compounds?
(a) Covalent bonds
(b) Electrostatic forces
(c) Van der Waals forces
(d) Hydrogen bonding

Visible light is not used to determine electron position because its wavelength is too large compared to:
(a) Energy
(b) Velocity
(c) Diameter
(d) Momentum

Which metal has seven electrons in its 3d subshell in +2 oxidation state?
(a) Cr
(b) Fe
(c) Co
(d) Cu

SI unit of power is:
(a) Joule
(b) Watt
(c) Newton
(d) Pascal

Energy possessed by a moving body is called:
(a) Potential
(b) Thermal
(c) Kinetic
(d) Chemical

Work is the product of force and what quantity?
(a) Mass
(b) Displacement
(c) Velocity
(d) Acceleration

A copper and iron wire connected in series; which gets hotter?
(a) Both same
(b) Copper
(c) Iron
(d) None

A body dropped on elastic surface returns to same height; KE vs time graph is:
(a) Linear
(b) Parabolic
(c) Triangular pulses
(d) Constant line

Work done by gravity is independent of path because:
(a) Path matters
(b) Weak force
(c) Depends on initial and final heights
(d) Friction cancels work
questions.answer: Depends on initial and final heights

questions.question:
tan (45°) equals:
(a) 0
(b) $1/\sqrt{3}$
(c) 1
(d) $\sqrt{3}$

The Mean Value Theorem states that there exists c where:
(a) $f^{\prime}(c)=0$
(b) $f(c)=0$
(c) $f^{\prime}(c)=[f(b)-f(a)]/(b-a)$
(d) $f(c)=[f(a)+f(b)]/2$

A complex number z satisfies $|z-3i|=3,$ largest $|z|=$
(a) 3
(b) 4
(c) 5
(d) 6

$f(x)=ln(x^{2}+1)$ is:
(a) Odd
(b) Even
(c) Periodic
(d) Unbounded

What is the main job of the operating system?
(a) To design websites
(b) To manage computer hardware and software
(c) To write computer program automatically
(d) To display internet ads
questions.answer: To manage computer hardware and software

questions.question:
Scanner that reads filled bubbles is:
(a) OMR
(b) OCR
(c) QR reader
(d) MICR

OOP principle bundling data and methods is:
(a) Inheritance
(b) Polymorphism
(c) Encapsulation
(d) Abstraction

In programming, which is used for decision making?
(a) while
(b) if-else
(c) array
(d) function

Which layer provides reliable delivery?
(a) Data Link
(b) Network
(c) Transport
(d) Session

In RSA, valid public exponent 'e' must satisfy:
(a) e < φ(η)
(b) $gcd(e,\varphi(n))=1$
(c) $e=\varphi(n)$
(d) $e=\varphi(n)/2$

Gas responsible for acid rain formation:
(a) $CO_{2}$
(b) $SO_{2}$
(c) $CH_{4}$
(d) $O_{3}$

Biodiversity is defined as:
(a) Number of species
(b) Variety of life
(c) Total mass
(d) Rate of formation

Biodegradable waste example:
(a) Plastic bottle
(b) Glass jar
(c) Aluminum can
(d) Apple core

Practice that improves soil fertility:
(a) Monoculture
(b) Crop rotation
(c) Over irrigation
(d) Clear cutting

Radon comes from decay of:
(a) Plutonium
(b) Uranium
(c) Thorium
(d) Potassium

Transition zone between two ecosystems:
(a) Edge effect
(b) Ecotone
(c) Biome
(d) Succession

Boundary marking Sun's influence end:
(a) Kuiper Belt
(b) Asteroid Belt
(c) Oort Cloud
(d) Heliopause

Planet that rotates on its side:
(a) Mars
(b) Jupiter
(c) Uranus
(d) Neptune

Great Red Spot on Jupiter has existed for:
(a) 50
(b) 150
(c) 350
(d) 1000 years

Moon of Saturn with dense atmosphere:
(a) Enceladus
(b) Iapetus
(c) Rhea
(d) Titan

Hexagonal cloud pattern on Saturn is called:
(a) Great Dark Spot
(b) Polar Vortex
(c) Hexagon
(d) Jet Stream

Asteroid belt is between:
(a) Earth & Mars
(b) Mars & Jupiter
(c) Jupiter & Saturn
(d) Venus & Earth
